TITLE: 6 health insurance terms you need to know as open enrollment begins
SUMMARY: Millions of Americans pick their health plans during open enrollment. Several moving parts under the surface can make those selections challenging.

TITLE: 5 key personal finance issues this midterm election season — and what they mean for your wallet
SUMMARY: Here are some of the most pressing personal finance issues for the midterm elections — and how Tuesday's results may affect your wallet.

TITLE: Supreme Court again declines to block Biden's student loan relief plan
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court on Friday rejected a second request to block the Biden administration's student loan debt relief program.

TITLE: This individual retirement account deduction mistake may derail your tax break
SUMMARY: If you're expecting a deduction for pretax individual retirement account contributions, you need to know the IRS rules to qualify.

TITLE: Layoffs are picking up. These are the first 3 steps to take after losing your job
SUMMARY: A job loss can be traumatic, setting off a myriad of financial problems. But taking the right steps can help reduce the disruptiveness.

TITLE: Powerball's jackpot is $1.6 billion, the largest lottery prize ever. If you win, here's how much would go to taxes
SUMMARY: If there's a winner in Saturday night's Powerball drawing and they pick the upfront cash option, here's the tax bill that would come with their windfall.

TITLE: Fidelity, ForUsAll now offering 401(k) investors access to cryptocurrency
SUMMARY: Fidelity Investments and ForUsAll appear to be the first 401(k) administrators to offer workers access to cryptocurrency.

TITLE: Free returns may soon be a thing of the past as retailers roll out stricter policies
SUMMARY: From shorter return windows to restocking fees, expect there to be limitations on what can be brought back and when.

TITLE: Op-ed: High-net-worth investors can amplify their charitable impact with a 'recoverable grant'
SUMMARY: High-net-worth charitable donors can use a smart tool to support non-profit innovation this giving season. It's called a recoverable grant.

TITLE: Interest rate hikes have made financing a car pricier — especially if you have bad credit. How much you could pay
SUMMARY: With the Federal Reserve's latest interest rate hike — the sixth this year — auto loans are poised to become even more expensive.

TITLE: 26 million borrowers have applied for student loan forgiveness. But GOP challenges put plan at risk
SUMMARY: Close to 26 million Americans have applied for student loan forgiveness. But the White House's plan could be in jeopardy due to GOP legal challenges.

TITLE: Fidelity is the latest employer to offer free college education to workers
SUMMARY: More employers, including Fidelity, Citi and PNC, are expanding their benefit offerings with free college programs to attract and retain workers.

SUMMARY: Here’s how your mortgage, credit card, car loan, student debt and savings could be affected by the latest major Fed rate hike.

TITLE: Before dropping a Medicare Advantage plan altogether during open enrollment, compare these key costs
SUMMARY: If you are thinking about dropping your Advantage Plan in favor of basic Medicare, your costs will likely look different, experts say.

TITLE: Here’s how to adjust your portfolio as the Fed hikes interest rates again
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve enacted its fourth three-quarters of a percentage point interest rate increase to fight inflation. Here's what it means for investors.

TITLE: Families can get Pell Grants of up to $6,895 to help with college costs. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: Many undergraduate students who are eligible for Pell Grants don't apply. Here's what to know about the aid, which can make college more affordable.

TITLE: As Election Day approaches, Democrats warn that Social Security and Medicare are at stake
SUMMARY: Democrats, including President Joe Biden, say the midterm elections may decide the future of two programs retirees rely on, Social Security and Medicare.

TITLE: Op-ed: Don't reject the 60/40 portfolio. Embrace it
SUMMARY: Amid unique geopolitical and financial circumstances that are hammering stock markets, some are questioning the traditional 60/40 stocks/bonds investment model.

TITLE: This Social Security quiz can help test how much you know about benefits before you claim
SUMMARY: Deciding when to collect Social Security benefits may be the biggest retirement decision you make. This quiz can help test how much you know about the program.

TITLE: Treasury Department sold a record nearly $1 billion of Series I bonds on Friday, the deadline to lock in higher rate
SUMMARY: Investors rushed to beat the Oct. 28 deadline to lock in a record-high 9.62% interest rate. The I bond rate reset Nov. 1, falling to 6.89%.

TITLE: Treasury Department announces new Series I bond rate of 6.89% for the next six months
SUMMARY: The Treasury Department on Tuesday announced Series I bonds will pay 6.89% annual interest through April 2023. Here's what investors need to know.

TITLE: A resale 'revolution': Affluent shoppers embrace secondhand shopping
SUMMARY: The resale business is now growing twice as fast as the broader retail market, helped, in part, by a surge of affluent shoppers.

TITLE: Here's what the inverted yield curve means for your portfolio
SUMMARY: When shorter-term government bonds have higher yields than long-term, known as yield curve inversions, it’s one signal of a future recession.

TITLE: Politics and your portfolio: Midterm elections create uncertainty for markets
SUMMARY: Midterm elections are a week away. Investors may want to change investments based on what they think the results may be. Advisors say that would be a mistake.

TITLE: 'Don't end up in a lopsided portfolio.' Here's what advisors say to do if you’re worried about tech exposure
SUMMARY: Big companies stocks slid after last week's earnings reports, and experts say it's an opportunity to better diversify your investments.

TITLE: You may experience a 'mysterious disappearance’ on Halloween — and insurance probably won't pay for it
SUMMARY: Some renters and homeowners insurance policies have clauses that deny payment if personal property is lost due to unexplained circumstances.

TITLE: Education Department overhauls federal student loan system, aiming to make it 'simpler, fairer and more accountable'
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education announced sweeping new changes to the federal student loan system, including additional consumer protections for borrowers.

TITLE: Powerball jackpot hits $1 billion — but only if you pick the less-popular prize option. If you win, here's the tax bill
SUMMARY: Regardless of whether you take the windfall as an annuity spread over three decades or as a lump sum payment upfront, taxes take a big bite out of the winnings.

TITLE: Another interest rate hike from the Federal Reserve is on the way: Here's how it may affect you
SUMMARY: To fight inflation, the Fed is expected to enact its sixth interest rate increase of the year at its policy meeting this week.

TITLE: How top-ranked financial advisors are responding to near-retiree concerns about inflation, longevity
SUMMARY: Here's what financial advisors who made CNBC's FA 100 list in 2022 are telling their older clients amid historic inflation and market volatility.
